intro: Scleria papuana, commonly known as the Papuan Scleria, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, particularly Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. Scleria papuana typically grows in wet, tropical environments such as marshes and swampy areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
